metadata.titel_preek: Newness from God That Unlearns Family

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transition from a restricted, family-based identity to a universal, God-defined identity through the 'unlearning' of traditional boundaries.

tekstueel_bewijs: Peter explains to his church friends why he has undertaken this new behavior
He had to break free of what his family had taught him
We must unlearn some of what they taught us
God’s newness that causes us to unlearn so much
God’s fuller purpose for our lives

zender.identificatie: The Voice from Heaven / God's Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: The voice of heaven said to him: What God has made clean you must not call unclean
The church is opened to Gentiles
God’s arms of love are large
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (Peter) who must perform the unlearning.

helper.identificatie: The Dream / The Spirit / Jesus' Example
tekstueel_bewijs: The dream might be a fantasy, but they took it as a word from God
God’s Holy Spirit... came upon them
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Sender (mandating change) and Helper (providing the dream), while Man is the Subject.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that 'comes upon' to validate a change in behavior.

tegenstander.identificatie: Family Tradition / Mother's Teaching / Fear / Exclusivity
tekstueel_bewijs: The rules in the family tend to be small and fearful
Old rules from his mother and from his synagogue
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not Sin or Death in a cosmic sense, but rather the sociological and psychological limitations of upbringing and tradition.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's cosmic renewal of all things (Eschatological).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A new world without tears or death
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (human unlearning) is presented as the necessary 'part' or response to get 'in sync' with God's secondary, larger program.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is fashioning a new world
I [God] am making all things new
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must unlearn some of what they taught us
We do not resist it either

voorbeelden: We want to keep things the way they used to be
Peter knew that he was to meet with this uncircumcised non-Jew

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily driven by obligation (Devoir). The 'Newness' is framed as a mandate that the human subject must execute by overcoming their past.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Mother's teaching) to ~S2 (Unlearning) to S1 (Universal Love).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through the human act of 'not resisting' the dream/vision.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as 'good but limited' rather than 'sinful' or 'deadly'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the language of 'God's newness,' the engine of the sermon is the hearer's effort to 'unlearn' and 'embrace.' God provides the vision, but the hearer is the Subject of the transformation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We must unlearn some of what they taught us in order to meet Jesus.
Unlearn... in order to meet Jesus.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The dream... was a word from God, an interruption in his safe life.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter is used as a psychological model for the hearer's own process of outgrowing family biases.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God forcibly converts Peter's heart, proving that God's grace overcomes even the most 'orthodox' human resistance.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation/Newness is a task to be achieved through cognitive and social shifts.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is coherent but collapses the 'New Creation' (Soteriology) into 'New Commandment' (Ethics).
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God making all things new' and 'Our part is a new commandment'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: We Christians are people open enough to be led by Christ to newness.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit validates the unlearning but doesn't seem to be the source of the 'Pouvoir' (Power) to do it.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as 'small and fearful' family rules rather than a condition of death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a call to action where the hearer is the hero overcoming the 'villain' of narrow tradition.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'unlearning' and 'meeting Jesus'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the subject who 'unmasks' our idols and 'drags' us into his kingdom.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We must unlearn,' use 'The Gospel unlearns us; it strips away our small loves to give us God's great love.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Unclean' who is received, or the 'Resister' who is conquered by Grace.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize Peter's helplessness and God's persistence (three times!).

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit gives the power to love those we naturally fear.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'Opponent' as the human heart's innate hostility to God's reign.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'Mom's rules,' we don't need a Savior, just a therapist.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim the New Creation as a finished fact in Christ, which then frees us to love.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a beautiful vision of inclusion but places the burden of achieving that vision on the hearer's psychological effort.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is inviting and warm; actantially, it is a demanding law-structure.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis focuses on the historical Peter; Greimas shows how the 'Peter-function' is transferred to the 'Hearer-function'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Newness' is treated as an Object to be acquired rather than a Subject that acts upon the world.

volledige_subject_lijst: Peter (speaks, speaks first, became leader, faced crisis, explains, undertook)
We (meet, notice, imagine, grow, watch, teach, do, tell, remember, give thanks, unlearn, move)
God/Voice (breaks, spoke, said, is fashioning, is making)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses Mother's Day as a foil for the Gospel, which creates a narrative where the Gospel is the 'adult' stage of human development.
